website_summaries.verdict: The ceiling heater to choose when you need the most power output and heat for a larger space.
pros: Heavy-duty construction is reliable through consistent use
Controls are easy to find and use to set the desired temperature

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Unit puts out great heat for my three car garage! Added a remote mount thermostat at the suggestion of Amazon while placing the order. I was fortunate to have the breaker panel next to where I mounted the heater, so installation was a breeze! I turn the thermostat down to 50F at night and turn it up to 70F about 30 minutes before I go out to work in the garage and it’s nice and warm when I go out there.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: be careful
customer_reviews.text: I received the heater today and I was excited to mount it but I heard a noise while unpacking it and it was the fan blades and bolts off the motor and rattling inside the unit. This is a serious issues for someone that has no technical skills. I have a question to whoever it may concern: do you guys know what a law suit is??? you guys can kill somebody and about your quality check that you claim? probably the heater will work good but I will upgrade this miserable status pretty soon. People be careful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! the nut that holds the fan needs to be put it on counterclockwise!! Shame on you Comfort Zone
customer_reviews.author: Enzo

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for Excellent Heating
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this heater for my new shed. I did have it installed by an electrician as it is wired through a thermostat controller and into the circuit panel. I only wanted to keep the shed at around 50 degrees through the cold winter months. This heater does the trick efficiently taking only a few minutes to bring the temp from 25 to 50. The shed is 12 by 16. Not big. Definitely recommended for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: This is the 2nd heater I bought.
customer_reviews.text: Put this heater in shop also but when I seen this one on the front steps it was in the comfort zone box. My fist one came in a unmarked box with the comfort zone box inside. When I picked it up I shook it and heard rattling. when opening the box and taking unit out found fan motor and fan blade laying inside unit screws and washers were rolling around inside unit. Put it back together and it seems to work fine. How can you box a heater up knowing the parts are not installed right comfort zone.
customer_reviews.author: KEN WIEDERRICH

customer_reviews.title: Quality and price, would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I purchased this heater there was no problem with a loose fan as some of the reviews said,I have a 24×24 garage that has insulation on the ceiling but not on the walls,at 45° outside I put the heater on low setting and in about 10 minutes the garage temperature rose to 65° ,on initial start up there some vibration but stop's in a couple minutes,will update this as the temperature drops
customer_reviews.author: richard walker

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2 car garage -- but fan not properly installed
customer_reviews.text: I received this, mounted it to the garage ceiling, and wired it up to a 30a breaker and turned it on. I was greeted with a LOT of rattling and squeaking as soon as the fan came on. As some other reviewers have noted, this unit shipped the fan nut barely on. I had to take the unit down off of the ceiling and open the front panel in order to access the fan and tighten the nut. Let's see how it holds up... but obviously there's some kind of QC issue happening at the manufacturer. It makes me worry about the longevity of this heater. Currently debating on whether to return for a unit from a different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: need to balance fan
customer_reviews.text: Would have been 5 star, but. When unit came on, it had an annoying rattle. I found that the blades, on the fan, were bent out of shape and out of 'tune'. Take grate off. take the 2 motor mount screws out. Turn fan and motor upward. Take fan nut off. Take fan and lay on flat surface. Tune fan blades by pushing down on tips of each blade. There should not be any 'teeter-totter' effect (tips of each blade must touch table at same time). Once you have 1 side 'tuned', turn fan over, repeat. Now it is very quiet! Hope this help.
customer_reviews.author: mark wiser

customer_reviews.title: Delivers Heat very well
customer_reviews.text: We installed these in our Greenhouse Project. They are doing the job we expected keeping the Greenhouse at a preferred temperature. They wired up easily but we found that it would have been nice if the knockouts were on both the left and right side of the units instead of just one side. This meant that we either ran additional wire to reach around the unit to the knockout entry side or take a chance and drill our own knockout hole on the one side so that wire could be ran straight into unit. We took the second option and drilled it out.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald M.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: The fan blade was not physically attached to the fan motor. Unfortunately I did not notice that until it was installed. FYI it’s a reverse thread nut holding it on. I just saved you a half hour if it happens to you. I fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: james lancaster

customer_reviews.title: at least it didn't catch on fire
customer_reviews.text: the nut that holds the fan on fell off during its second use. there is a plastic hub on the motor shaft that fell into the heating element and MELTED. I couldn't get a replacement part, I was told I had to return the entire unit. I had to disconnect the wires, unmount it, find a box and ship it back. I made the mistake of ordering another one, when the new one arrived it was missing the hanger bracket. I am relieved that the melted plastic didn't catch on fire, but the next time I am cold I think I'll dump gas on the ground and light it on fire, that'll be more efficient and just as safe.
customer_reviews.author: JonnySideways

customer_reviews.title: A lil prep before install and this item is good to go.
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews about it coming with the fan blade loose and or completely disassembled. So first thig i did was checked the bolts and such on the fan blade and made sure i was good to go. Installed this item according to specs and it runs great and puts off very warm air even on the lowest settings in 35° weather. Once the walls are up on my shop I'll update this review to discuss the difference in temp from outside to the inside of my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Jon  B

customer_reviews.title: Lousy quality, lousy company. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: CZ220 heater. POS! Gave it one star because you have to select something. Get it installed and fan blade falls off on day 3. Go thru the hassle of taking it down, tearing it apart and putting blade on. As noted by others, screw tightens counter-clockwise. Run the heater for one minute, turn it off, blade falls off. Call customer service, and speak with a lovely VM. I would not recommend this to anyone. If customer service ever calls me, I will add to my review
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Mumford

customer_reviews.title: Works well but poor internal fan
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, the fan started rattling and making loud noise after just a couple of days. I fixed it by tightening the fan blade and installing a lock washer. Also, the internal fan is not strong enough and it shuts off immediately when the heater coils shut off. I solved this by hanging a small 110 V fan on the back to keep continuous air circulation and cool down the coils when the heat cuts off. See photo. (I tried to add a photo but it would not work)
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: This is one HOT heater!
customer_reviews.text: What a hot little unit!!! Heats the office up in my shop like a charm. Easy to install and wire, but removed one star since the knockouts for wiring are only pre punched in one side. Get out the drill and file if you need to wire into the left side of the unit. (I was replacing an old Dayton unit and had a fixed wire length). Haven’t needed on the highest wattage setting yet, haven’t turned it up past half with the built in thermostat. (If you elect to use, I recommend painting the dark arrow with some white paint so see where it’s set). Overall, very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: C. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Can't miss with this one!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical considering the price and very surprised when I opened the box and saw the product. These units are very well designed and manufactured solidly. I've got two of them heating an 8640 cu ft space. I'm running them both on the 3kW setting and barely have the thermostat turned on, about 10% or so and it keeps this shop space comfortable at about 65 degrees. If I had to ding it on anything, it is that the thermostat does not have an index position indicator on it, but that is easily remedied with a paint marker. You can easily spend twice the money per unit and not have half the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great garage heater
customer_reviews.text: I hung this heater in my 26x24 garage. I typically heat my home and garage with a wood burning stove. The stove is in the garage, and ducted into the house. I occasionally work away from home, and don't want anything in my garage freezing on me while I'm away. This was a perfect solution to that problem. I have it connected to a thermostat, set it at 50, and don't have to worry about a thing. Well worth the price. Ready to go right out of the box, No loose parts as others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Ronrizz

customer_reviews.title: I like my heater, But.
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing so was aware of a loose fan issue. Indeed after about an hour use the fan fell off and the plastic mount dropped into the heating element and partially melted the bushing. I was able to repair it and seems to be working fine now. Makes a person a little concerned that the factory hasn't noticed this problem and created a Fix. A bit discouraging to buy new and have to repair it almost immediately. No special tools required to fix just time spent and a little LOCK TITE on the threads.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money and “Our units are not serviceable” the response I got from customer service
customer_reviews.text: Heater crapped out less than a year In, fan motor quit. Emailed customer service and received this In Return........ Buyer beware!! Thank you for contacting World and Main. Regretfully, we do not sell nor carry internal parts for our products. Our units are not serviceable. Should you have any further questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us again
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I had a welding receptacle in the garage, so I wired the heater with that plug. My garage is insulated so this heater brings the temperature up quickly. Great value, works great. With the three power settings (3kw, 4kw, 5kw) I also use it as a test load for my portable generator.
customer_reviews.author: straight facts

customer_reviews.title: Good heater but a little on the noisy side
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 24 x 24 insulated shop and seems to work good so far, although we have only owned it for a few weeks. Will see after a few months when it gets colder here in NW OK. The fan inside the heater was not screwed on and had to assemble it. Is a little noisy when it comes on. Disappointed in the price. Paid $129 and then found this same heater at our local Atwoods store for $89.95. Amazon not always the cheapest.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: This is a small furnace folks
customer_reviews.text: my furnace went out and winter was here and I didn't have the money for a replacement furnace or service so I bought this connected it to my heating ducts and this little baby heats my three level home and i only have it on the second setting and i live in MI, if I were a contractor building homes I'd install these in my homes.
customer_reviews.author: R hogan

customer_reviews.title: Very nice heater.
customer_reviews.text: For 2 months now, this heater has worked very well for me. I keep it between off and low just to prevent my laundry room water pipes from freezing in Chicago weather. The only thing I wish is this heater to have a thermostat to set a specific temperture; other than that, great unit.
customer_reviews.author: D Carbajal

customer_reviews.title: Worth way more than it cost
customer_reviews.text: Impressive. Self installed in two-car insulated garage in NYC. Several 28 degree days and its easily 65-70 in garage with heater on lowest power setting and thermostat in 11 o'clock position (about 45% of max on lowest of 3 settings). You don't need a separate thermostat if you can reach the front of this unit when installed. At a regular ceiling height, an average height woman can easily reach it without stretching. You can set and leave it and it will maintain the room at that temp by periodically shutting itself off and on as needed.
customer_reviews.author: MSS

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. Could force more air but can't really complain for the price. And it's pretty quiet too. Seems pretty sturdy and did what others said to do and red locktite the fan assembly hardware. Will update later if anything happens. No doubt that it will last a long time. Like what everyone else said it's built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Good cost and works well!
customer_reviews.text: Keeps 2 stall garage above freezing in the winter with the thermostat set on low. It could easily heat our well insulated garage to 70+ degrees in below freezing temps. Will raise your electric bill about $40-$60 dollars a month in the winter when it’s below freezing. Worth it to me so snow and ice melt off the vehicles and can get into a warm car.
customer_reviews.author: DevonD

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Wired it up to a separate thermostat that's mounted on the wall in my shop. No issues with rattling fan blades. They must have gotten the hint from the reviews about it because the one I received had the fan set screw tight and lock-tite was applied. I live in the Northwest and my shop is about 1300sqft and well insulated with insulated garage doors. It works fine for maintaining 50 degrees when I'm not in there and it takes about 20min to get to 65 on the 4000 watt setting when I go out to work. It's a compact little heater and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This Heater won't let down!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really great heater!!! I need this because my central heat burnt up!! I use it to heat a14 by 72 mobile home no issue!! The only thing is don't buy the plug if going to plug it up to a normal 220 plug in will not work!! The one I bought on here wasn't even close to fitting!! So pay attention to plug in you buy and you can't go wrong!! Amazon is the best place to shop never had issue with there products!!! Shipping sometimes take longer but is what is !! I am a proud prime member!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 27' by 30' garage - mounted from ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 27' by 30' garage - mounted from ceiling blowing down to far corners drawing power from a new NEMA 14-50 240v 50A circuit. Keeps the temp at proper working range in 30 degree weather. Hasn't been tested below freezing, however.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K

customer_reviews.title: fan blade was tight. Works well, quiet fan.
customer_reviews.text: It works well, reasonably quiet, the fan blade nut was installed tight(Oct 2020) with a thread lock product. I reapplied locktite. To offset a big electric bill, I plan to use my propane to preheat if freezing . 17,000btu's is what my 330sq ft block garage calls for. It has three settings and a thermostat knob but no degree marks printed . 30amp240v breaker, 10gage wire, actual draw 21amps@240v on high. The unit could be controlled from a remote thermostat, the fan normally stops as soon as the internal thermostat is satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Joe W

customer_reviews.title: Good performing heater.
customer_reviews.text: My dad has two similar heaters and I chose the smaller of the two as I am only heating a single car garage. Very simple and easy hookup and the unit works very well. The quality and finish appears to be good and the controls are easy to use. I would not hesitate to buy this heater again. The plus was very speedy delivery as well.
customer_reviews.author: A. B.

customer_reviews.title: noisy
customer_reviews.text: I install this unit in my two car garage. It was relatively easy to install. After running for a few minutes it started to make a rattle noise. It seems the fan motor vibrates and causes rattling noise. Not sure if that will effect the operation of the unit. I guess only time will tell. Just some advice, If your not handy with electric then get someone who is. The electric can be challenging. Over all not a bad unit for small space.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Muraczewski

customer_reviews.title: Broken upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: Just open box to install heater found that the fan blade is loose and not attached to the motor. Renders unit completely worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well so far. 50 hrs of use. Bought 2 for 24x30 uninsulated garage. Brings temp up about 20-30 degrees from outside temps after 2 hrs of use. Maintains between 40-50 F when outside temps between 10-25. Can reach and maintain 60 F when outside temp is over 35.
customer_reviews.author: David P. Folsom

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this is where it's at! I installed it myself in about 30 mins. I'm a welder, not an electrician and it was very simple. I did already have a 220 plug for my welder so I just ordered a male plug and hard wired it to the heater, mounted it where I wanted and boom. Works great. I'm only heating a 2 car garage so I will update on how well it works this winter! Hope this helps someone decide. But for 80$ I had to try!
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Regret purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing to heat a 2 car garage as the Amazon listing said it would do. Well if this thing is 5000 watts I'll eat it! I had a 1500 watt quartz heater that put out more heat than this thing. Also it rumbles and rattles and vibrates sounds like a coal truck driving by. Forget this friggen thing and get a propane heater instead.
customer_reviews.author: R E Smith

customer_reviews.title: received disassembled and missing parts
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers pointed out, this product is often shipped with the fan blade being loose. With the product I received, the fan blade was completely detached from the motor. There were two washers and a nut loose in the heater but there is still something missing, the fan blade cannot be attached using just these parts, a bushing or something similar is required. This is completely unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mcculley

customer_reviews.title: Noisy fan but effective
customer_reviews.text: I love this heater, does a great job heating my garage where I work a lot, however the noise from the fan is awful. Have taken the rear shield off but can’t get it to run quieter. Don’t want to return it as it heats fine. I hope the bearings are not going out of the fan motor.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Give Me Heat
customer_reviews.text: Fast delivery and very fair price. The heater was as described and was easy to install. I did a test run and all operated properly. Will be a welcome addition this winter.
customer_reviews.author: FH

customer_reviews.title: Used, missing parts,  not fully functional.  Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: The unit i recieved was beat up with chipped paint, several missing screws and had wear marks on the mounting bracket, indicating that it had been installed and returned. The fan was loose and the power indicator light doesn't function either. I wouldn't trust it unmonitored. I know the price is tempting, but I'd recommend buying a different heater if you can afford it. This one is chinese crap.
customer_reviews.author: Renloe

customer_reviews.title: Heater works well.
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy and the power indicator LED has stopped working after a couple of months, but the heater heats my garage pretty well. Insulated 30' X 24' X 10' height in size.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Heater does heat up over 500 sqft.
customer_reviews.text: To start with the first heater was delivered with parts loose inside unit. (fan blade and mounting hardware) Did the return and order a second unit. Delivered in 2 days (Amazon is great). New heater installed with no issues and heating the garage to t-shirt comfort. Good buy for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fan blade comes loose and stops working
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and used it for 4 days and it no longer worked. When I looked inside it through the grill I could see there was no fan anymore. I returned this one and bought another one and I received the new one in the same condition as the one I sent back. Blade and washers laying in the bottom of the heater detached from the unit. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Nolet

customer_reviews.title: Should have a more powerful fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice heater for the price.. perfect size.. easy to install and wire. Wish it came with a more powerful fan, that's why I give it only 4 stars .
customer_reviews.author: L. Plourde

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The unit is quiet and heats up my 24x32 shop..takes longer than expected.. but does the job without the fumes of my kerosene. Heater
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Getting this thing returned with no problems!!
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with this product it doesn’t pump out heat like I was expecting from the reviews I saw! I have it installed in my 400 sqt garage and it is still freezing cold in there... The heat barely comes out! The only nice thing is how quiet it is and it would probably work good for a space 100-200sqt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: For the price definitely worth it. Mine didn’t have the blades loose i just took it out the box and installed no problems. Ive used it a few times and warms up pretty good on my 420 sqft garage and the ceiling is partially insulated.
customer_reviews.author: Jose J Avalos

customer_reviews.title: Good quality fan for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality fan for the price, I’ve been using to heat my 12’x10’ greenhouse for a couple of months now, it has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Good heater
customer_reviews.text: Have 2 of these, 1 for shop, 1 for garage. 2nd unit was not well assembled and rattled like crazy. Loose screws on back grill and loose fan blade, tightened and unit quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Ken King

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed and cold
customer_reviews.text: Gets warm but the fan is very weak and i had to go in and tighten the fan blade. And it still makes noise. Im only using it in a one car garage and it wont get it remotly warm. Like for the manufacturer to make it right with me or send me the parts to make it work
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: heats great.
customer_reviews.text: heater works great. all winter heated a 10' x 20' room at minimum cost.
customer_reviews.author: Art D.

customer_reviews.title: Fan blade problem
customer_reviews.text: I use this heater to heat a 16x16 shop office in central Illinois. Works very well! However, the fan came off of the motor the first night in use and could have been a serious problem. As it is hardwired to a dedicated circuit breaker, no “real” emergency existed. My son took the unit apart and reattached the fan blade with a little Locktite. Unit works as it should now and I am happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: r stayton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my shop
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for heating my small shop. Three different heat settings and simple thermostat control makes it simple.
customer_reviews.author: CRM

customer_reviews.title: Great seller , Great product !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got heater and installed , power on light didn’t work . Seller responded with in 25 mins of e mail and had replace my on the way with a return label . Replacement works perfect. Great seller !!! Love the heater . All is well . Thanks again World and Main !!! You guys are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph attard

customer_reviews.title: Great price easy install
customer_reviews.text: I am not an electrician but I had plenty of space in my breaker box so I decided to try it. The hardest part was feeding the new wire.i suggest buying fish tape. This was easy to install and it heats my 2 car garage perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Secret

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this heater. Warns up a 2.5 garage in one hour
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Heater works great!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this heater for our basement, warms up the floors upstairs so nice.... heat heater
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K. Muracco

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Heater arrived as promised, seems very solid. Easy to install and works well. We use it in a 16X16 room with very little insulation, warms it up from 50 to 70 very quickly. I'm a little nervous because it was so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Littleton

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I am using this heater in a well insulated 14 x 20 building and it is more than adequate to heat it up to a comfortable temperature. Even in our harsh Minnesota winter it maintains a warm temp easily and I have never regretted the purchase. I would buy again since it is a good product at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: FAN BLADE NOT ATTACHED
customer_reviews.text: beware if you are not handy. you may not want to buy it as mine came with the fan blade not attached. Had to take it apart and re attach the fan blade. Not what I expected to have to do.
customer_reviews.author: MIC

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Unit was easy to install. sturdy construction and works well, so far
customer_reviews.author: AJD

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It seemed to work well but the fan sounded pretty bad right out of the box, and I found out it was bad. I only used it to maintain a temperature just above freezing in a well insulated detached garage. The fan only lasted a month and a half. Very disappointed. Price was good but you seem to get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really seem to put out that much heat for a 220v heater
customer_reviews.text: I have a 110 volt electric wall heater in a bathroom that out performs this unit.
customer_reviews.author: John Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Seems okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit to heat an insulated work shed in the winter. It's now June, so I haven't fired it up yet. So far, however, it looks quite handsome hanging from the ceiling and it's most quiet.
customer_reviews.author: David Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: The fan is not attached very well. went through 2 of these in less than a few days and in both cases the fan comes off. this unit looks good but is not worth it. More trouble than it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well keeping our garage at a comfortable temperature. Only thing I wish it had was ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well keeping our garage at a comfortable temperature. Only thing I wish it had was a guide on degrees instead of just high and low
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great takes a little longer to heat up but I placed it in a larger room
customer_reviews.author: Eddie B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I have a gym in my 2 car garage and I bought it to heat it up in the winter time. Works great. No complaints. It will get the space from about 30 degrees to 65 in about 15 min then I turn it to the lowest setting or even off while I workout for about an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Tayler Macon

customer_reviews.title: just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I need to keep my garage warm this winter while I work on projects. easy to install and good directions.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Poorly assembled
customer_reviews.text: Installed it and found fan noisy. Like the blade was loose. Ordered replacement and that one arrived with fan blade completely off of fan motor. So I repaired the first one I ordered and sent second one back. Works fine after an hour and a half extra labor. And now I have to take the time too send the MORE broken one back.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Good price works great eating a 24 by 24 garage with it works great very happy
customer_reviews.text: Really like this thing works great very easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Don k.

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I liked that the heater seems to be well constructed. I disliked the fact that the fan blade came separated from the fan motor. Parts were scattered throughout the heater bottom. I had to take the heater apart to re-attach the fan blade. Fortunately, nothing was damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Kinosz

customer_reviews.title: CZ220 Fan separation
customer_reviews.text: I bought two CZ220 garage heaters and after one hour of initial use the fan blade separated from it's shaft. The other unit makes a rattling sound so I suspect the fan is also loose. I'm returning these to Amazon and buying another brand. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Brown

customer_reviews.title: Check the fan bolt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 26x26 garage in SW Idaho. It’s typically in the 20’s and 30’s in Dec and Jan and this works quite well. The only problem I’Ve had is the fan came off the shaft after about 2 months of use. I was able to repair it, took about an hour. Overall I am pleased with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Tromburg

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike here ,good price,seems well built ,nice and worm
customer_reviews.author: steve herring

customer_reviews.title: work very well and also very quiet
customer_reviews.text: An easy installation, a quiet running motor and enough heat to make my 600 plus square garage as warm as we like it combine to make this heater a winner in our estmation

customer_reviews.title: I only wish it heated the garage faster, but ...
customer_reviews.text: I only wish it heated the garage faster, but waiting 30-minutes or so is plenty for the room to get hot.

customer_reviews.text: enclose the back deck in the winter with 6mil ploy so wife can smok out side this heater works very good So wife is very happy with it had up in on about 45mins.

customer_reviews.title: Works well in a small area
customer_reviews.text: I have a 24' x 24' garage and it is well insulated. Used the gas furnace to bring up to temperature. then use this heater to hold temp around 65 degrees. It will not heat the hole garage but it will for what I intended to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Not to shabby
customer_reviews.text: This little powerhouse gets the job done!!! I have a small shop 25x18 that’s not insulated. Give this heater about an hour or two and your all set to get some work done!

customer_reviews.text: I put this in my 25 by 25 shop. It keeps it very nice even when it is below 40 outside.

customer_reviews.title: Great Shop Heater

customer_reviews.title: It makes some serious heat.
customer_reviews.text: This thing cooks. I heated an uninsulated enclosed trailer used as a temporary office for 2 weeks effortlessly. Theres a bit of noise but this should be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great heater. Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great heater for the money. I have a well insulated ( walls and ceiling) 39x26 shop and the heater is all it takes to keep it warm. It’s not even turned up 1/2 way. Wire per the directions!!

customer_reviews.title: Bad item!
customer_reviews.text: Item received and installed as instructed. After realizing that the fan wasn't working, took the unit down from the wall and found that the fan blade was laying loose inside the unit. Factory worker never mounted the blade to the motor!

customer_reviews.title: great product.

product_meta.title: Comfort Zone CZ220 Fan-Forced Ceiling Mount Heater with Dual Knob Controls
feature_bullets: SPACE-SAVING DESIGN: The fan-forced heater is designed for ceiling mounting and hard-wired installation, which saves valuable floor space in a packed warehouse, garage or storage area.
DURABLE STEEL CONSTRUCTION: The body of the commercial heater is crafted from heavy gauge steel, which stands up well to the temperature fluctuations in areas that are poorly insulated.
TARGETED HEATING: Louvers and a variable mounting angle direct airflow where it is needed most, while the fan-forced design helps to distribute it throughout the room.
CONVENIENT CONTROLS: The dual knob thermostat allows you to easily adjust the temperature to just the right level for your space and to turn the ceiling mount heater on and off quickly.
SMART SAFETY FEATURES: A built-in sensor switches the device off automatically if it overheats, while a power indicator light ensures that you know when the unit is in use.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars511 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
